issue.title: [CF 115] Mis-categorized debuffs (Entangling Roots, new Priest fears)
issue.body:
ATTACHING A SAVED VARIABLES FILE/SCREENSHOT WILL GET YOUR TICKET ANSWERED MUCH FASTER

Saved variables can be found in: "World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<Account Name>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen. lua"

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. open /tmw configuration
2. select spell ID
3. select pulldown item "Crowd Control"

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Entangling Roots is in Crowd Control, but it is the only debuff in that group that allows actions.  It probably should be in "Root" group instead, where it is not currently.
Also, the Fear group does not contain two priest fears: Psychic Horror or Sin and Punishment.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
3.0.4a

Do you have an error log of what happened?
n/a

Please provide any additional information below.

I'm sorry I don't know where to find spell IDs for debuffs.
Thank you!


> Posted by CurseForge user trentio | Imported from CurseForge issue #115 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: RootGroupRequest.jpg

RootGroupRequest.jpg

<p>Shows "Entangling Roots", probably misplaced.</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user trentio

Psychic Horror: 64058 is disarm, and 64044 is fear. Both titled Psychic Horror, but disarm lasts longer.

Edited Feb 6, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user trentio

The reason that roots is under CC is because it is very common for a druid tank to root a melee mob to start the pull, and keep it rooted until logic says that it should be the next kill target. Entangling roots not being under roots is a bug, however (and a slightly ironic one), and I'll fix it.

I'll add Sin and Punishment as a fear, but PH isn't really a fear because it just sits you in place (it is currently under stuns, because that is what it acts like).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

right. makes sense. I was thinking from a PvP healing perspective, rather than PvE CC'er.

My CC warning list is pretty long: Feared;Incapacitated;Disoriented;Stunned;Silenced;CrowdControl;Sin and Punishment

because I use crowd control for like about 8-10 items on the list, I get one I don't want (entangling roots).

Re: priest debuffs: If it acts like a stun, I like it under stuns, thanks! And sorry, I hadn't noticed Psychic Horror there.

Thanks for the great AddOn!

Edited Feb 7, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user trentio
